StudyInfo.StudyNameEntrez: Genes in non-syndromic congenital heart disease-CIDR

Policy.acknowledgement_statement: INSTRUCTIONS: Approved Users are expected to acknowledge the Submitting Investigator(s) who submitted data from the original study to an NIH-designated data repository, the primary funding organization that supported the Submitting Investigator(s), and the NIH-designated data repository (e.g., dbGaP). The acknowledgment statement should include the dbGaP accession number to the specific version of the dataset(s) analyzed. These data were the product of the following investigators and funding sources: Elizabeth Goldmuntz in the Division of Cardiology at the Children’s Hospital of Philadelphia, Department of Pediatrics at the Perelman School of Medicine at the University of Pennsylvania; Laura E. Mitchell and A.J. Agopian in the Human Genetics Center, Department of Epidemiology, Human Genetics and Environmental Sciences, University of Texas Health Science Center at Houston School of Public Health. The work was supported by grants from the National Heart, Lung and Blood Institute (R01-HL74094, P50-HL74731), including the Pediatric Cardiac Genomics Consortium (U01-HL098188, U01HL131003, U01-HL098147, U01-HL098153, U01-HL098163, U01-HL098123, U01-HL098162); the National Center for Research Resources (M01-RR-000240, RR024134 [now the National Center for Advancing Translational Sciences (UL1TR000003)]); the Eunice Kennedy Shriver National Institute of Child Health and Human Development (P01HD070454); and the Center for Inherited Disease Research (X01HG010415).

ConsentGroup.title: Health/Medical/Biomedical
ConsentGroup.name: HMB
ConsentGroup.Use-Restriction: Use of this data is limited to health/medical/biomedical purposes, does not include the study of population origins or ancestry.
